alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Pike County through 1030 AM EDT... At 945 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gulnare to 7 miles southeast of Paw Paw. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raccoon, Chloe, Shelbiana, Garden Village, Virgie, Rockhouse, Jonancy, Marrowbone and Lookout. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 9. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 3 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
